articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump issues veto over Senate border resolution
articles.description: President Trump has issued his first veto, rejecting a resolution passed by Congress that would have overturned his emergency declaration on the border. But his plan to steer funding to build barriers still faces challenges. Paula Reid reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: U.S. sees steady rise in violent right-wing extremism
articles.description: A deadly shooting on two places of worship in New Zealand was allegedly carried out by a gunman targeting Muslims. The U.S. has seen a rise in violence by white supremacists. Jeff Pegues reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: New Zealand shooting leaves at least 49 dead
articles.description: At least 49 people were killed by a white supremacist who targeted Muslims in two places of worship. The alleged gunman, who streamed video of the attack on social media, is in custody. Daniel Sutton of Ten Australia, is there.

articles.author: Omar Villafranca
articles.title: 15-year-long oil spill is the longest in U.S. history
articles.description: An oil platform was destroyed when Hurricane Ivan hit back in 2004
articles.content:
Port Eads, La. — In 2004, Hurricane Ivan plowed across the Gulf of Mexico and triggered an oil spill that is still leaking. It's the longest continuous oil spill in American history.
Captain Rick Jiannuzzi took CBS News to where the Taylor oil rig once stood… [+1639 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Sunday: Kaine, Bharara
articles.description: Sen. Tim Kaine and Preet Bharara to appear Sunday on “Face the Nation”
articles.content:
The world is reeling Friday after a bloody massacre at two mosques in New Zealand. 
The attack, which injured dozens and claimed 49 lives, prompted an international outpouring of condolences. The suspected shooter's manifesto, drenched in vicious, white supr… [+2348 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Friday, March 15, 2019
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News" with Jeff Glor.

articles.author: Dean Reynolds
articles.title: Midwest flooding turns deadly
articles.description: At least one person died as floodwaters rose to dangerous levels
articles.content:
Fond du Lac, Wis. — Across the Midwest, flooding forced thousands to seek refuge in shelters. Waterlogged highways were closed, and governors proclaimed disaster areas as floodwaters rose to dangerous levels. 
There was at least one fatality, after a farmer … [+996 chars]

articles.author: Kris Van Cleave
articles.title: Jackscrew could hold clues to deadly crash in Ethiopia
articles.description: Three minutes after takeoff, the pilot made his distress call
articles.content:
Washington — French aviation experts on Friday began work on the heavily damaged black boxes from Sunday's Ethiopian Airlines disaster. The crash site is also providing new clues into what may have claimed 157 lives.
Sources told CBS News investigators at th… [+1721 chars]

articles.author: Maureen Maher
articles.title: Was a killer filmed on his way to committing a murder?
articles.description: Three murders in nine days Austin, Texas, and little evidence to go on -- did a man testing a thermal imaging camera inadvertently capture one of the killers?
articles.content:
Produced by James Stolz and Jaime Hellman 
After three murders with chillingly similar scenarios occurred in Austin, Texas, police began to wonder if they were chasing a serial killer. But whomever committed the crimes left no evidence, no DNA. Cops went int… [+39500 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Senator Chris Coons on "The Takeout"
articles.description: Delaware Senator Chris Coons joins Major Garrett to discuss Joe Biden’s candidacy, the question of impeachment, and how the definition of socialism has evolved in the post-recession era on this week’s edition of “The Takeout" with Major Garrett.

articles.author: Grace Segers
articles.title: Bernie Sanders' campaign becomes the first-ever to unionize
articles.description: The United Food and Commercial Workers Local 400 will represent them as their exclusive bargaining representative, according to the campaign
articles.content: Staffers for Bernie Sanders' presidential campaign is now the first-ever major party presidential campaign to unionize, according to a statement released Friday. The campaign said that the United Food and Commercial Workers Local 400 had been chosen by the ma… [+1056 chars]

articles.author: CBS/AP
articles.title: Apple owes Qualcomm $31 million for patent infringement, jury rules
articles.description: Qualcomm and Apple have been sparring over who invented key technology used in many mobile devices
articles.content:
Apple violated patents and should pay $31 million in damages to mobile chip maker Qualcomm, a jury ruled. The verdict Friday in a San Diego federal court follows a two-week trial pitting two former allies that have become bitter adversaries.
The lawsuit stem… [+883 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Delia Owens on "Where the Crawdads Sing"
articles.description: The author's bestselling novel is love story, murder mystery, courtroom drama, and ode to the outdoors all in one
articles.content:
It's almost in Canada, with a view of Montana. That's how remote this northern corner of Idaho really is, worlds away from almost everything, except nature. For writer Delia Owens, it's heaven. Wildlife is her church, vast isolation her muse. 
Does she get l… [+5497 chars]

articles.author: Grace Segers
articles.title: Iowa Sen. Ernst says farmers could "turn quickly" against Trump
articles.description: Sen. Joni Ernst spoke about trade, her relationship with the president and friendships across the aisle
articles.content: Sen. Joni Ernst, R-Iowa, told reporters that farmers in her state could "turn quickly" against the president if President Trump's trade war continues. Ernst spoke at a luncheon sponsored by Winning for Women, an organization dedicated to recruiting and promot… [+4348 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: New Zealand prime minister: "Our gun laws will change"
articles.description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said in a press conference that her country's gun laws will change after 49 people were killed in shootings at two mosques. She also said the gunman was not previously on the radar of intelligence services. Watch her …

articles.description: "We're seeing an increase in the propaganda"
articles.content:
Washington — A deadly shooting on two houses of worship in New Zealand left at least 49 people dead. The alleged gunman targeted Muslims. 
The U.S. has seen a rise in violence by white supremacists, including the murders of 11 people at a Pittsburgh Synagogu… [+2391 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer reflects on reporting on the Syrian civil war
articles.description: CBS News foreign correspondent Elizabeth Palmer has covered the Syrian civil war from its start. In her reporter's notebook, she reflects on the cities she's traveled to and the people she spoke with.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: What's next for Syria after 8 years of civil war?
articles.description: Friday marked eight years of civil war in Syria, with no end in sight as it enters its ninth. Middle East cultural expert Diana Darke joins CBSN to discuss what could come next for the war-torn country.

articles.author: Sophie Lewis
articles.title: Zion Williamson thanks Nike for making him stronger shoes
articles.description: "The shoes were incredible in this game," Williamson said after leading his team to victory against Syracuse
articles.content: Duke University's Zion Williamson is finally back on the court following a month-long injury spurred by a burst Nike shoe. Williamson and coach Mike Krzyzewski shared some insights into the making of Williamson's new shoes during a post-game press conference … [+2800 chars]

articles.title: James Gunn brought back to direct "Guardians of the Galaxy 3"
articles.description: Months after being fired over old tweets, James Gunn has been rehired as director of "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3"
articles.content:
Months after being fired over old tweets, James Gunn has been rehired as director of "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3."
Representatives for the Walt Disney Co. and for Gunn on Friday confirmed that Gunn has been reinstated as writer-director of the franchise … [+2871 chars]
